intro: Cynoglossum crista-galli, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescence that resembles a beard, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and they bloom from late summer to early autumn. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
